IN THE BUSINESS OF:- Solving your tax problem.- Empowering and educating you about your rights as a taxpayer. - Negotiating with the most aggressive collection agency on the planet (IRS) on your behalf.- Giving you peace of mind about your tax situation so you can sleep at night.- Treating you and every client fairly and honestly with the highest quality service.
User experience research, interaction design, microinteraction design, usability testing and Axure wireframes, engagement with multiple project teams.

User experience research, determine standards, interaction design, worked with stakeholders,  business analysts and marketing. Produced wireframes with solutions and coordinated with UX designers and copywriters for final deliverables that contributed to the end products. Shadowed users for feedback regularly and initiated usability studies based on problematic areas. Wireframed usability recommendations for presentation to stakeholders.

Worked on complex projects requiring user experience focus such as a secured site for 1031  Exchange forms repository and processing. Produced wireframes and a prototype.Website project work and user experience projects on contract basis.

- Worked on a cross-­functional user experience team that developed agent facing technology serving 45,000 users nationally.- Created wireframes for planned agent portal. This involved collaboration with engineers, developers, stakeholders and business analysts.- Traveled to participate in agent user experience testing -­ paper prototyping and card sorting.- Worked with education and communication teams to create instructional content related toeach modification and "Writing for the Web" materials.- Wrote articles relating to features/upgrades on agent intranet site.- Partnered with my director to write and develop the insurance learning module on non-­profit organization web site. The Beehive -­ http://www.thebeehive.org/money/.

Focused on community organization and improvement. Created a program for single mothers - Provided debt counseling and negotiated with creditors and IRS and set up payment plans. Connections with foster kids in Arizona

I feel that Jennifer has great marketing skills for properly presenting a company on the web.

summary: For over 20 years I’ve helped people resolve credit and IRS tax problems and have made it my life’s mission. I started during college developing a program for single mothers paralyzed in financial distress. I successfully negotiated with creditors and the IRS and witnessed first-hand the positive impact the results had on families and their peace of mind. Through experience with hundreds of people revealing their most personal financial secrets, I wrote and published a book, Credit Crisis, A Step-by-Step Survival Guide. The book addresses problems I repeatedly expressed and provides proven solutions. It is written in an easy-to-understand format for readers already overwhelmed. I sidelined consumer finance as full-time work during the Internet boom and joined the emerging field of user experience design (UX). I was privileged to work with amazing people, teams and projects during my years in UX. The work fit my need to figure things out and use common sense design to solve problems for users. While working in UX, I continued providing services part-time for credit and IRS tax problems. It became obvious that although I enjoy UX work, my heart is in making a difference at a personal level. Financial literacy impacts every person, family and generation. This heart tug focused me back to my mission: helping with creditor and IRS problems for financial peace of mind. The most urgent need seems to be with IRS help, so I dedicated my business to solving IRS problems. Frankly, some of the most common, costly and devastating mistakes are made by taxpayers representing themselves.Those who have worked with me get relief from their IRS problems and the daily stress they bring. A client’s peace of mind is my biggest reward and having such a positive impact on people, families and generations motivates me to do and be my best each day. I can help with your IRS tax problem and may be reached at (480) 502–9333.
name: Jennifer L. Michaels
title: Owner, IRS Help 911, LLC
